DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Severe Autoimmune Or Immune Symptomatic Personal Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Yes/no indicator for the history of severe autoimmune disease, a condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them, as an abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Severe Autoimmune Or Immune Symptomatic Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the history of severe autoimmune disease, a condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them, as an abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: Severe Autoimmune Or Immune Symptomatic Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: Intensely or extremely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality, or extent; life threatening.:Pertaining to autoimmunity.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Protected against infectious disease by either specific or non-specific mechanisms. (On-line Medical Dictionary):Having to do with symptoms, which are signs of a condition or disease.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Protected against infectious disease by either specific or non-specific mechanisms.
Exhibiting the symptoms of a particular disease.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: History of severe autoimmune
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of severe autoimmune or immune-mediated symptomatic disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Active (as defined by requiring immunosuppressive therapy) or history of clinically significant autoimmune disease (as defined by previously requiring immunosuppressive therapy).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participants must not have had prior autoimmune disorders requiring cytotoxic or immunosuppressive therapy, or autoimmune disorders with visceral involvement.  Participants must not have an active or inactive autoimmune disorder (e.g., rheumatoid arthritis, moderate or severe psoriasis, multiple sclerosis, inflammatory bowel disease, etc.) or who are receiving therapy for an autoimmune or inflammatory disease requiring these therapies are also excluded.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient receiving treatment for an active autoimmune disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of autoimmune disorders requiring cytotoxic or immunosuppressive therapy, or autoimmune disorders with visceral involvement. Active or inactive auto-immune disorders (e.g., rheumatoid arthritis, moderate or severe psoriasis, multiple sclerosis, systemic lupus erythematosus, inflammatory bowel disease, etc.) requiring treatment The following will NOT be exclusionary:  Vitiligo, thyroiditis or eczema requiring systemic steroids at a dose <=7.5 mg/day of prednisone or equivalent.  Individual cases can be discussed with the Principal Investigator.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participants must not have had prior autoimmune disorders requiring cytotoxic or immunosuppressive therapy, or autoimmune disorders with visceral involvement. Participants must not have an active or inactive autoimmune disorder (e.g., rheumatoid arthritis, moderate or severe psoriasis, multiple sclerosis, inflammatory bowel disease, etc.) Participants who are receiving therapy for an autoimmune or inflammatory disease requiring these therapies are also excluded.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Eczema, psoriasis, lichen simplex chronicus or vitiligo with dermatologic manifestations only

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient currently undergoing active treatment for an autoimmune disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have history or risk of autoimmune disease that would exclude them from the study as defined in protocol section 3.4.16?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received systemic immunomodulatory medications (including but not limited to interferons, IL-2) within 4 weeks or 5 half-lives of the drug, whichever is longer, prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active, known or suspected autoimmune disease (other than those allowed per section 3.3 of the protocol)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have multinodular goiter, Graves' disease or autoimmune thyroiditis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active autoimmune disease or history of autoimmune disease that might recur, which may affect vital organ function or require immune suppressive treatment including systemic corticosteroids (as described in section 3)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have history or risk of autoimmune disease that would exclude them from the study as defined in protocol section 3.4.15?
